foxml:property.NAME: info:fedora/fedora-system:def/model#label
foxml:property.VALUE: A saxon-servlet based service deployment object for documented XSLT mappings.

foxml:datastreamVersion.LABEL: Dublin Core Record for this object

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A saxon-servlet based service deployment object for documented XSLT mappings.

body.p: The mapping from fields in the source records to fields in the SOLR document that serves as the source of data for Virgo is documented below. Each line can be read as a single rule or mapping from a piece of metadata in the source to a field that may serve as a facet, presented value or simple searchable text in the catalog.

Because of the commonalities between different sets of indexed materials, many of these mappings are "default" or inherited. The mappings are listed in order of precedence. Higher listed rules will overrule lower listed rules.

field.name: id
field.usage: Every solr document must define exactly one id field. The id value must not only be unique across a given collection, it must be unique within the entire Solr index. Attempting to add a document that has the same id as an already existing Solr document will cause that Solr document to be replaced. Note that the items in the Solr index from the Old Virgo ILS system have id values consisting of the letter ‘u’ followed by a number, so for material from other sources, the id must not be of that pattern.

field.name: content_model_facet
field.usage: TBD - but very important.

field.name: author_text
field.usage: This field is used for author searching. Multiple entries allowed. Each author_text entry consists of the name of one of the “authors” of the item being indexed (or more broadly “creator” of the item.) If, for instance, you have both the native script version of an author’s name as well as an English transliteration of the author’s name, include both versions of the name in separate author_text fields. If the item cannot be properly be said to have an author or creator (perhaps it is unknown) this item can be omitted.

field.name: author_added_entry_text
field.usage: This optional field is used for author searching. Multiple entries allowed. An additional field that can be used to list “authors” of an item, names listed in this field are not “weighted” as heavily in the search results as authors listed in an author_text field entry.

field.name: subject_text
field.usage: Multiple entries allowed. Each subject_text entry consists of a descriptive subject heading about the given item. When doing a “subject” search terms and phrases that appear in a subject_text field, will be weighted much more heavily than words and phrases that appear in all other text fields.

field.name: title_text
field.usage: Multiple entries allowed, although in practice there should be no more than two. This field should contain the main title of the item being indexed. Additionally if there is a native script version of the item’s title in addition to an English transliteration of the title, include both versions of the name in separate title_text fields.

field.name: subtitle_text
field.usage: Optional. Multiple entries allowed, although in practice there should be no more than two. This field should contain the sub-title (if any) of the item being indexed. Similar to the title_text field, include native script version of the subtitle in a separate subtitle_text field.

field.name: full_title_text
field.usage: This entry should consist of the main title and the subtitle concatenated together. It is used to boost exact title matches higher than matches that with only a part of the title.

field.name: alternate_form_title_text
field.usage: Optional. Multiple entries allowed. Additional related titles for the item. Possibly alternate titles for an item, or titles of a contained part (song titles from an album).

field.name: journal_title_text
field.usage: This field should contain the full title of the item being indexed, but it should only be populated if the item in question should be considered to be a journal or a magazine.

field.name: call_number_text
field.usage: Multiple entries allowed. This field should contain a separate entry for each individual “call number” assigned to an item. Ideally this would be a LC type call number, but any arbitrary numbering scheme can be used.

field.name: title_display
subtitle_display
main_title_display
series_title_display
part_display
author_display
creator_display
date_display
date_received_facet
media_resource_id_display
media_descirption_display
digital_collection_facet
datafile_name_display
location_facet
call_number_display
isbn_display
published_display
mint_display
accession_display
thumb_obv_display
thumb_rev_display
year_facet
year_display
published_date_display
linked_author_display
linked_title_display
linked_resposibility_statement_display
url_display
repository_address_display
field.usage: included (in some cases, depending on content_model_facet) in the search results display

field.name: year_multisort_i
field.usage: This index entry indicates the year of “publication” of the item. There can be only one value for this entry, because it is used for sorting, and it must consist of exactly 4 digits (preceded by an optional minus sign for B.C. dates). This means that if you have a range of dates, you must pick one to use. If you have an uncertain date (e.g. 197u) you must decide what value to use, or you must leave this index entry undefined.

field.name: title_sort_facet
field.usage: There can be only one value for this entry. This should consist of the full title of the item, including any subtitle. Then all punctuation should be removed from the title, any short, unimportant words at the beginning of the title (like “the” or “a” or “le”) should be stripped off, and lastly, the remaining letters should be converted to lowercase.

field.name: author_sort_facet
field.usage: There can be only one value for this entry. This should consist of the main “author” or “creator” of the item, in the order lastname firstname (as shown below) As with the title_sort_facet field, any punctuation should be stripped and the entire remaining letters should be converted to lowercase.

field.name: date_received_facet
field.usage: There can be only one value for this entry. This index entry is probably only relevant for items from the library catalog. Its value corresponds to the date the item was received by the library. Its format must be an 8 digit date of the following format: YYYYMMDD

field.name: call_number_sort_facet
field.usage: There can be only one value for this entry. This index entry is primarily used for sorting by the LC call number assigned to an object. Because the defined sort order for LC call numbers is idiosyncratic and complicated the value place here must be normalized to a complex and confusing form. For instance the LC call number HQ734.H366 would need to be normalized to be: HQ 0734.000000 H0.366000 good luck with that.

field.name: source_facet
field.usage: Required. For each set of different data loaded into the solr index. This field denotes (in some descriptive way) the source of that data. All items from a given source should have the same value for this field. Items from the library catalog have the value “Library Catalog”

field.name: digital_collection_facet
field.usage: Optional. Denotes a sub-category within the source_facet for subdividing items into separate catagories.

field.name: format_facet
field.usage: Denotes the form of the item being indexed. Multiple entries allowed. If something is a DVD, it should get format_facet entries of “DVD” and “Video”. Note the entry “Includes Video” indicates something that primarily is another form, ie. a book, but which also includes a video as supplemental material. Please see the list of supported values.
field.legalValues: Archives Audio CD Book Broadside Cassette Coin Cylinder DVD Equipment Government Document Includes Video Journal/Magazine LP Laser Disc Manuscript Map Microform Musical Recording Musical Score Newspaper Non-musical Recording Online Open Reel Tape Pamphlet Photographs Poster Slide Software/Multimedia Streaming Video Technical report Thesis/Dissertation U-matic Unknown VHS Video eBook

field.name: author_facet
field.usage: Multiple entries allowed. This should list all of the “authors” of an item. They should be formatted in a last-name-first order and in the examples below, and if there is a standard form for that persons name to make it less ambiguous, you should try to use that form.

field.name: published_date_facet
field.usage: This field attempts to provide a textual description of the date of publication of an item. Once date range searching is implemented, this entry may no longer be needed. The only values that should be put in this field are as follows: (However you should use all that apply.)

field.name: subject_facet
field.usage: This field attempts to provide a description of the topic(s) covered by the work. Since the greatest value of this facet is for finding other works covering similar topics, it is important that the same form be used from one item to another. You should try to use a LC subject heading for this item. If the subject heading has a hierarchical sub-division the separate parts should be separated by the characters “ -- “ (space, dash, dash, space).

field.name: call_number_broad_facet
field.usage: This should only contain a textual description of the LC call number for the item in question. If there is no LC call number, leave this field empty. Additionally this field is not currently used. Use the call_number_facet field (described below instead)

field.name: date_indexed_facet
field.usage: This field is used for index debugging purposes, it should be set to the date/time at which the solr add document is created. It should have the format YYYYMMDDHHMM

field.name: date_first_indexed_facet
field.usage: This field is used only for Marc record items. It specifies the date the item was first added to the index. It is used by the book cover retrieval system to know what’s new.

field.name: release_date_facet
field.usage: This field is used only for video items. If the video was released at the same time the movie was made, this value should equal the publication date. If the video is for a movie that was originally released years prior to the video, this field holds that original release date. Its format is simply a 4-digit year YYYY

field.name: shadowed_location_facet
field.usage: This field is used to prevent index documents from being returned in the normal course of searching. The only valid values are “HIDDEN” and “VISIBLE” If this field is omitted, it functions as if the value were “VISIBLE”.

field.name: library_facet
field.usage: This field is used to list the physical location of the item in terms of which library the item resides. If there is no physical item that the metadata references, this item should probably be left blank. The valid values for this field are as follows:
field.legalValues: Darden Business School Health Sciences Law School Alderman Astronomy Biology & Psychology Chemistry Clemons Education Fine Arts Mathematics Music Physics Brown SEL Special Collections Semester at Sea Ivy Stacks Robertson Media Center Mountain Lake Blandy Experimental Farm

field.name: location_facet
field.usage: This field is used to list the physical location of the item in terms of the specific location within a library. If there is no physical item that the metadata references, and the item is available directly via the interface, the value “Internet materials” should be used.

field.name: language_facet
field.usage: This contains the language(s) of the item in question. The full name of the language should be used, rather than an abbreviation. Additionally if a language is only peripherally used a suffix can be appended to denote this. For instance for a video that is primarily in French, but which has sub-titles in English, you could use the values: “French” and “English (subtitles in)” This list of the optional, parenthetical suffixes is listed below, followed by a full list of the accepted language names.

field.name: region_facet
field.usage: This field is used to provide a description of the geographical region covered by the work, not the location the item was published. As with other facet fields described here, using an identical representation for a given location is important so that other items covering the same region will be found. Although at present this field is not actually used, the following shows some examples of the current desired form for entries in this field.
field.legalValues: Albemarle County (Va.) Amsterdam (Netherlands) Arkansas Bulgaria Mississippi River Valley Cape of Good Hope (South Africa) Panama Canal (Panama) Williamsburg (Va.) Württemberg (Germany)

field.name: music_composition_era
field.usage: This field is primarily used for "music" type items. The values for this field denote when a particular music work was created, irrespective of the publication date of the specific item. For very early works, only the century is recorded. For works more recent than 1700 the decade of the work is recorded. Multiple entries are allowed, and all that are relevant should be applied. For instance for a collections of Civil War era compositions dating from 1842 to 1865, the facet values "1840's", "1850's", "1860's", "19th Century" should all be applied. Care should be taken to validate the values entered for this field; I guarantee that the item you are indexing was not composed in the 193rd century. The list of all values that are allowed in this field is as follows:
field.legalValues: B.C. 1st Century 2nd Century 3rd Century 4th Century 5th Century 6th Century 7th Century 8th Century 9th Century 10th Century 11th Century 12th Century 13th Century 14th Century 15th Century 16th Century 17th Century 18th Century 1700's 1710's 1720's 1730's 1740's 1750's 1760's 1770's 1780's 1790's 19th Century 1800's 1810's 1820's 1830's 1840's 1850's 1860's 1870's 1880's 1890's 20th Century 1900's 1910's 1920's 1930's 1940's 1950's 1960's 1970's 1980's 1990's 21th Century 2000's 2010's

field.name: call_number_facet
field.usage: This should only contain a textual description of the LC call number for the item in question. If there is no LC call number, leave this field empty. For the most part the entry only takes the first letter or two of the LC call number and includes the descriptive LC call number string for that division. There are a few instances where a large, common, subdivision is subdivided based on the numeric portion following the initial letters, as well as a couple of instances where less common subdivisions are combined together. The full list of allowable entries in this field are as follows:
field.legalValues: A - General Reference Works and Journals AC - General Collections and Collected Works AE - Encyclopedias AG - Dictionaries and other general reference works AI - General Indexes AM - Museums and Collecting AN - Newspapers AP - Periodicals AS - Academies AY - Yearbooks, Almanacs, Directories AZ - History of Scholarship B - Philosophy BC - Logic BD - Speculative Philosophy BF - Psychology BH - Aesthetics BJ - Ethics BL - Religions, Mythology, Rationalism BM - Judaism BP - Islam, Bahaism, Theosophy BQ - Buddhism BR - Christianity BS - The Bible BT - Doctrinal Theology BV - Practical Theology BX - Christian Denominations C - Auxiliary Sciences of History (General) CB - History of Civilization CC - Archaeology CD - Diplomatics, Archives, Seals CE - Technical Chronology, Calendar CJ - Numismatics CN - Inscriptions, Epigraphy CR - Heraldry CS - Genealogy CT - Biography D - History (General) DA - History : Great Britain DAW - History : Central Europe DB - History : Austria, Liechtenstein, Hungary, Czechoslovakia DC - History : France, Andorra, Monaco DD - History : Germany DE - History : Greco-Roman World DF - History : Greece DG - History : Italy, Malta DH - History : Low Countries--Benelux Countries DJ - History : Netherlands (Holland) DJK - History : Eastern Europe (General) DK - History : Russia, Soviet Union, Former Soviet Republics, Poland DL - History : Northern Europe, Scandinavia DP - History : Spain, Portugal DQ - History : Switzerland DR - History : Balkan Peninsula DS - History : Asia DT - History : Africa DU - History : Australia, New Zealand, South Pacific islands DX - History : Romanies E11-E143 - History : America E151-E904 - History : United States F1-F975 - United States local history F1001-F1146 - History, British America (including Canada) and Dutch America F1170-F1170 - History, French America F1201-F3799 - History, Latin America and Spanish America G - Geography (General ). Atlases, Maps GA - Mathematical geography. Cartography GB - Physical Geography GC - Oceanography GE - Geographic aspects of Environmental Sciences GF - Human Ecology and Anthropogeography GN - Anthropology GR - Folklore GT - Manners and Customs GV1-GV100 - Recreation and Leisure GV1199-GV1570 - Games and Hobbies GV1580-GV1799 - Dance GV1800-GV1860 - Circuses, Amusement Parks, etc. GV201-GV1198 - Sports and Physical Education H - Social Sciences (General) HA - Social Science Statistics HB - Economic Theory and Demography HC - Economic History and Conditions HD - Industries, Land Use, Labor HE - Transportation and Communications HF - Commerce HG - Finance HJ - Public Finance HM - Sociology (General) HN - Social History and Conditions. field.name: collection_title_display
collection_title_text
field.usage: This contains the title for the archival collection (finding aid) associated with this record which itself represents some component or item within that collection.

field.name: collection_pid_display
field.usage: The pid of the fedora object for the collection. This is used for the links in the breadcrumbs display for each hierarchical search result.

field.name: collection_abstract_display
collection_abstract_text
field.usage: A brief description of the archival collection. This is displayed in the search results for the item representing the collection.

field.name: hierarchy_level_facet
field.usage: The level of the coponent described by this record. This may be "series", "item", "collection" or any of the other valid level specifiers.

field.name: c0x_title_display
field.usage: The name of the component for the given level (x is 1-6). This is used for the breadcrumbs display for each hierarchical search result.

field.name: c0x_pid_display
field.usage: The pid of the fedora object for the component at the given level (x is 1-6). This is used for the links in the breadcrumbs display for each hierarchical search result.
